model

Class RecursiveSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.RecursiveSolver

  • public class RecursiveSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the routines to solve a Sudoku puzzle using the Recursive Backtracking method.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Arthur Thouzeau

      private SudokuBoard sb

      Initializes a new Recursive Solver.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int countSolutions()
      Creates the list of unassigned cells and starts the recursive procedure with the first one (calls the recursive method countSolutionsBacktrack(int[][], int, boolean)).
      private int countSolutionsBacktrack(int[][] emptyCells, int ind, boolean flag)
      Recursive Backtracking function carrying out trial and error, trying to find a compatible value for each unassigned cell.

      Returns the Sudoku board.

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public SudokuBoard getBoard()
        Returns the Sudoku board.
        Returns:
        the Sudoku board

      • listEmptyCells

        private int[][] listEmptyCells()
        Enumerates all unassigned cells of a Sudoku board.
        Returns:
        the list of unassigned cells in a Sudoku board as a 2D array

      • solve

        public boolean solve()
        Creates the list of unassigned cells and starts the recursive procedure with the first one (calls the recursive method solveBacktrack(int[][], int)).
        Returns:
        true if the sudoku has a solution; false otherwise

      • solveBacktrack

        private boolean solveBacktrack(int[][] emptyCells,
                     int ind)
        Recursive Backtracking function carrying out trial and error, trying to find a compatible value for each unassigned cell. In case of multiple solutions, this method will stop at the first one discovered.
        Parameters:
        emptyCells - the list of unassigned cells
        ind - the index indicating where the algorithm is at in the list of unassigned cells
        Returns:
        true if the sudoku has a solution; false otherwise

      • countSolutions

        public int countSolutions()
        Creates the list of unassigned cells and starts the recursive procedure with the first one (calls the recursive method countSolutionsBacktrack(int[][], int, boolean)).
        Returns:
        0 if the sudoku has no solution; 1 if it has a unique solution; 2 if it has multiple solutions

      • countSolutionsBacktrack

        private int countSolutionsBacktrack(int[][] emptyCells,
                          int ind,
                          boolean flag)
        Recursive Backtracking function carrying out trial and error, trying to find a compatible value for each unassigned cell. In case of multiple solutions, this method will stop at the second one discovered.
        Parameters:
        emptyCells - the list of unassigned cells
        ind - the index indicating where the algorithm is at in the list of unassigned cells
        flag - the parameter indicating whether a first solution has already been discovered
        Returns:
        0 if the sudoku has no solution; 1 if it has a unique solution; 2 if it has multiple solutions
